1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: Elvis the cat has a nasty wound on his neck after a fight with a fox. Shadow the Staffy is brought in after suffering seizures. A strange looking chicken has been found wandering the streets of Liverpool.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Stephen, head vet at Kirkdale, battles to save the leg of George the pug puppy. Vet Beth faces an uphill struggle with stubborn cat owners. Local radio star Barney the budgie has a problem with his feathers.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Kirkdale head nurse Lisa makes it her mission to nurture poorly hedgehog Spike back to full health. Pebbles the Chihuahua undergoes an operation to remove a nasty growth from her lip.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: Kleeo the Staffordshire terrier requires delicate surgery to remove a lump from her nipple. An abandoned baby squirrel gets a new mum. Frankie the Chihuahua is off his food.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: Bull mastiff Bob from Birkenhead faces surgery to remove a tumour, while cat Belle has been shot with an air-gun and vet Hayley must decide whether to remove the pellet. Staffie Max has a mystery limp.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Chihuahua puppy Buddy traps his paw in a patio door. Mittens the rabbit is rushed in after its cage-mate dies mysteriously in the night, and Jen operates on Rottweiler Roxie's eye.

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: Shih Tzu Bella is losing weight, three-week-old baby chick Rosie has fallen from a height and can't walk, and head vet Matt gives kitten Gavin the once-over.

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: 10-year-old Jack Russell, Tabasco, faces surgery; budgerigar George is losing his feathers; Snowy the cat has his tail removed after cancer, and Hurley the Labrador has puppy training.

9.title: Episode #1.9
9.plot: Stephen meets Ronin, a yappy Lhasa Apso who's driving her owner barking mad. Beth performs emergency surgery on Honey, an ageing German Shepherd with a life-threatening illness.

10.title: Episode #1.10
10.plot: Huyton head vet Matt searches for the cause of wandering tomcat Loki's lame left leg. And love is in the air as inseparable American bulldog crosses Lexie and Floyd come in together.

11.title: Episode #1.11
11.plot: Vet Beth battles to save Tilly the pug's damaged eye, while Karla treats Sky, the lurcher whose leg wound won't stop bleeding. Plus there's a seagull that's fallen out of the sky.

imdb.plot outline: An observational documentary series going behind-the-scenes at two of the UK's largest charity animal hospitals in Kirkdale and Huyton on Merseyside. Both are operated by the People's Dispensary for Sick Animals (PDSA) one of Britain's largest animal charities that offers free or reduced cost treatment for the pets of people who may otherwise struggle to pay expensive vet bills. Across the series viewers will meet some of the staff at Kirkdale and Huyton, their patients and the owners of those patients.
imdb.title: The People's Vet
plot: Behind-the-scenes series following the staff and patients of the UK's leading veterinary charity.::Anonymous
